timeline.message:
handle return type selection better and add csv filenames

Conflicts:
	src/main/java/edu/harvard/iq/dataverse/api/Metrics.java
update rsync call to use new ok() method
prefer csv when client doesn't care
add unique and toMonth file download options
don't show 0 total count dates in timeseries
debug log causes failure with no dataverse sent

timeline.bodyText: This method doesn't handle arbitrary JSON. Maybe rename to flatJsonToCsv? And add some docs on when to use it?
timeline.author: pdurbin

timeline.bodyText: I'm used to the "orDie" methods working including the original findDataverseOrDie to work in certain way, to work on unpublished things, to throw a WrappedResponse when it can't be found. Since this method only returns published dataverses maybe it could be renamed? This is just a passing thought. I can also live with it with the current name.
timeline.author: pdurbin

replies.bodyText: Not sure I understand why this doesn't look like an orDie method - if the alias requested doesn't exist, it throws an exception (a WebApplicationException rather than WrappedResponse to use the updated error handling that's been added). Is it what is returned that is an issue or something else? Or just findPublishedDataverseOrDie ?
replies.author: qqmyers

timeline.message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'IQSS/develop' into
IQSS/7177-enhance_metrics_api

Conflicts:
	doc/sphinx-guides/source/api/metrics.rst
Report missing file sizes and return 0 instead of null
don't fire a log message if metricscachetimeoutminutes isn't set
Enable per dataverse reporting of all metrics
sanitize incoming yyyymm info as in Metrics API
refactor response logic, add fileTypes by Date, add MDC per Dataverse
fix test to match MetricsUtil changes
return null for null input and more debug
alphabetic compare against string monthyear column
Validate country code to ISO 1366 and cache per country
move country code validation out of Entity
default to current month instead of null
add json tree of dataverses endpoint

Simplify error handling

Most methods with a throws Exception clause only throw Runtime
exceptions
Those exceptions should be being caught by the rest framework and in
5.0+ by the new
edu/harvard/iq/dataverse/api/errorhandlers/ThrowableHandler

The exceptions being caught directly now are all related to checking
user input and result in BAD_REQUEST status. Runtime exceptions should
result in INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR status and post 5.0 will be logged via
the ThrowableHandler (see#7136).
fix type cast and check for no parent dataverse
allow CORS requests to send accept header
csv for dataverse by subject and category
add files time series, timeseries util, restore /datasets
files by type time series with csv
update name of query select column
stop while when out of results

update files/ByType, caching, naming cleanup

Conflicts:
	src/main/java/edu/harvard/iq/dataverse/api/Metrics.java

Constraining calls to require released parent dataverse

change in Metrics.java should result in a 400 error, avoiding leaking
info that a draft dataverse with that alias exists
changes in service bean avoid listing un-released child
dataverses/datasets in trees/lists - the individual queries should still
filter out un-released results, but a) just-in-case, and b) to be more
efficient, we can filter here too
fix where /and clauses for various cases
support downloads total and views total queries
